definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to pick up a girl/to get a girl

sentences.english: You want to see the organism hybridized from the dragon and the horse?
sentences.chinese: 为什么小龙女不愿意当奥巴马的马子啊？

sentences.english: Every day T'ao went to the north yard where Ma lived, and helped him care for the chrysanthemums.
sentences.chinese: 陶三郎每天去马子才住的北院，帮他培养菊花。

sentences.english: My chances of ever being in a relationship are now next to zero.
sentences.chinese: 看来我绝对不会有钓到马子的可能性了。

sentences.english: T'ao seemed to be very poor, and ate his meals at Ma's house every day.
sentences.chinese: 陶三郎家好像很贫穷，平日都在马子才家吃饭。

sentences.english: That chick is super hot in that mini-skirt.
sentences.chinese: 那个马子穿那件迷你裙超辣的。

sentences.english: For my Ma, I have a boundless love.
sentences.chinese: 对于我的马子，我有无限的爱恋。

sentences.english: Ever wonder why "bad boys" and criminals get the women?
sentences.chinese: 你曾疑惑过为什么“坏小子”和罪犯们能泡到马子？

definition: erhua variant of 哥們|哥们[ge1 men5]
my old mother/I, this old woman/my old lady (colloquial)/maternal grandmother/midwife
to pick up girls/to play around with girls/to chase after girls
(Wu dialect) bum/wretched-looking tramp who lives by begging or stealing
